author: sussman
msg: For 'svn switch', don't worry about splitting the path into
anchor/target.  The only reason we do this for regular updates is
because the target might need to be deleted, and thus the
update-editor needs to be anchored on the parent dir.  But for a
switch, this shouldn't happen.  If the URL we're switching to doesn't
exist, an error will be returned anyway.
The *real* reason we're doing this: it has the nice effect of causing
the wc directory to be transformed into a different directory *without*
* switch.c (svn_client_switch): for a switch, don't split path; anchor
the update editor directly on the path.
* ra_plugin.c (do_switch): remove split flag;  anchor pipe editor

author: kfogel
msg: APR_FINFO_PROT to get perms, fix comment.  See thread on dev list
"Subject: apr_copy_file and apr_transfer_file_contents" for more on

author: kfogel
msg: Found another place where keyword values are gathered.  Abstractify
date truncation, and use it in both places where date is obtained:
the inline code committed in revision 1095.

author: kfogel
msg: A few followup changes to revision 1114:
(svn_cl__notify_added_item): Print a warning if a problem arises,
macro saved some space, but it obscured references to the
opt_state->quiet flag and to the notification functions.  For example,
suppose you're updating a baton, and need to do a search for all
occurrences of the given function/baton pair?  Badness.  But, since
this change makes saving space even more important, remove "_item"
above changes to cl.h and feedback.c
